page.title: 14RECREATION - AS A TEENAGER
page.content: Life as a teenager in Keevil is a mix- ture of various activities. There's the playing field where we have to make our own fun. Every Thursday we have a Youth Club in Keevil Hall. Mr Davis and Mrs House run it one week and Mr and Mrs Blackmore (my mum and dad) run it another week. We can play snooker/pool, table tennis, bagatelle, and we've bought our own ghetto- blaster. We recently helped to clear up and tidy the churchyard. As we have to find our own transport, we can't just wander off into the town, Trow- bridge, where most of us go to school at Clarendon Comp. Ten people go fishing at Busley Bottom.We are lucky, there are no teenagers with drug or smoking problems. We think the older people call us vandals and we get very downhearted about this. Living as a teenager in Keevil is GREAT!!!
